FuncDef:
The user-vlan command configures a user VLAN in a service scheme.
The undo user-vlan command deletes the user VLAN configured in a service scheme. The user-vlan command configures a user VLAN in a service scheme. The undo user-vlan command deletes the user VLAN configured in a service scheme. By default, no user VLAN is configured in a service scheme. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K and CE6820S.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of a VLAN.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

ExtraInfo: After creating a service scheme using the service-scheme (AAA view) command, you can run the user-vlan command to configure a user VLAN in the service scheme. The user assigned with the service scheme will be added to the user VLAN and obtain network resources in the VLAN.
